de.systemagmbh.components.logger.writer
Class ASysFileWriter

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.components.logger.writer.ASysLogWriter
      de.systemagmbh.components.logger.writer.ASysFileWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysComponent, ISysLogWriter
Deprecated. As of release 2.5, replaced by de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.writer.ASysFileWriter

public abstract class ASysFileWriter
extends ASysLogWriter

This class represents a special type of ISysLogger that logs to a named file.

There is one "active" logfile written. The name of this log file is built by the 'fileName' specified in the configuration. If that name is for example 'theName' the "active" log file is named 'theName.log'. Additionally the 'process id' or the 'instance' can be appended. (E.g. 'theName_321.log'. Here the 'process id' is 321.)
If the 'process id' has to be appended has to be defined in the configuration. If a value for the key ISysLogConstants.PID in section ISysLogConstants.SECTION_PROCESS is set this value is used as 'process id'.
If the 'instance' has to be appended it also has to be defined in the configuration. (Key ISysLogConstants.KEY_INSTANCE in section ISysLogConstants.SECTION_COMMAND_LINE has to be set.

When the length of the "active" file extends the specified maximum length (parameter 'FileSize' in the configuration; default value is 1024*1024), it is renamed. The number of remaned backup files is limited (parameter 'NumOfFiles' in the configuration; default value is 3). The concrete handling of creating the backup files has to be done by the implementation of this abstract class.

A complete configuration for this logger coult look like that:
LogPathBase = \basedir
LogPath = \dir1\dir2
LogFile = LogFileName
NumOfFiles = 4
FileSize = 2000 # in kByte
PID = true # allowed: true/false. If true PID is appended to the file name.

If the instance is given in the system properties (-Dinstance) the instance is appended to the log file name.

Version:
$Revision: 1.13 $ $Date: 2005/08/18 13:35:49 $
Author:
Torsten Knauft, Robert Hartl, Udo Friedrich
